Define a static or minimum percentage of contacts allocated to each contact type or group
Define a static or minimum percentage of contacts allocated to each agent group or management unit
You may override the forecast generator's intraday distribution of contacts and AHT by defining a custom distribution.
You may use special days to ignore a past day's historical data when you generate a forecast
You may use pre-planned schedule activities to affect the forecast allocations when you use dynamic planning for multi-site and multi-skill
To add pre-planned open events and apply them at a skill group level during forecast & schedule generation
To edit the monthly volume and AHT for a contact type
The forecast generator creates the contact volume and AHT forecast values per period
To save a copy of the active forecast or an existing short-term forecast to a new short-term forecast
To adjust the system generated contact volume forecast values and AHT forecast values
If you modify the contact volume forecast values or the AHT forecast values, you may need to regenerate the allocations to update forecast allocations
Automatic Agent Assignment supports fixed and flexible scheduling, and considers an agent's skills during generation. Automatically assigns schedule to each agent
A schedule pattern is a fixed start time, end time and events on a specific day of the week. It does not have any specific date. Can assign patterns to agents based on rank
To create active schedules (similar to schedule bidding), but you skip agent viewing and ranking the patterns. Does not use bid process to assign agents
To create schdules based on Team Leader grouping
Activity codes represent activities on schedules and the historical activity record for agents
Rules to specify the working hours/conditions for a day. Defines a single daily schedule
Rules to specify the working hours/conditions for a week. Defines a set of rules for a week
Defines the rotation of schedules for a period
Define the limits and valid sequences of shifts for different agent groups/units
Use the Agent Profile view to view or edit profile information for an agent or multiple agents
Use the Agent Skills view to enter an agent's skill assignments
Use the Agent Availability view to define the work rules and availability associated with each agent
An agent's choices regarding the schedule he would most like, for example preferred start time, preferred lunch time, and so on
To define the min and max number of agents the system may schedule to occupy a seat during schedule generation basis their skill group
To store information for each agent and sort or filter agents on views and reports
Describes the database setup to invoke and manage holiday fairness days and rotations
Describes the database setup to invoke and manage schedule fairness days and rotations

Multiweek scheduling is a pre-schedule generation process that allows designating an agent hours date range (up to 6 weeks in length) and a goal for the number of hours to schedule each agent during the agent hours date range
Schedules are generated for a specific date range instead of being confined to a 7-day work week constraint
Use Requiremenst for more than 1 Week
Same requirement generated by a forecast could be used for simulations for any other period
For schedule overhead (unplanned off-phone activities) to adjust the requirements during schedule generation
To monitor daily actual call, AHT, Service Level, staffing at an interval level
To monitor  how many FTEs the system scheduled for various activities at each interval of the day
Monitor real time agent state information from the desktop application
Monitor real time agent state information from the web station

To view or modify information received from one or more ACDs or multimedia servers showing the real activity of an agent. System stores data in 1 minute increments. Each minute represents a state or an event
Designate dates and times to exclude from the Adherence report
To modify schedules for a single agent for a single date or a date range
To modify schedules for multiple agents for a single date
To trade schedules between two agents. You may trade schedules between agents even if they are in different groups using the desktop application
To trade schedules between two agents. You may trade schedules between agents even if they are in different groups using the web station
To view, approve or deny agent schedule changes made using WebStation
Monitor and manage productivity performance of agents
The reporting system includes many reports to help you manage your contact center
Use Web station to view different reports
Adherence, Conformance, Agent Schedules, Weekly Schedules, Performance Analysis & Utilization Reports
Define Types of Time Off (vacation requests)
To calculate earned time, based on the type of time off
Define the parameters, and types of time off, that govern the use of bidding through web modules (Supervisor and Agent)
To define groups for Time Off types and assign rules to a group
Calculate the hours earned, for each agent for each type of time off
Define the parameters, and types of time off, that govern the use of bidding through web modules (Supervisor and Agent)
Define how much time to allow off each day. If using wait list functionality, determine who to assign time off to when time becomes available
To define slots for activity codes based on date and time, minimum slot length, agent data group and value, and agent skills. You can also define whether the slots are visible to agents in WebStation
Define a user account to grant access to the application
